title: What Do Red Dragonflies Mean? Everything You Need to Know

steps.title: Life after death
steps.content: Life after death Red dragonflies are often believed to appear at moments of death and loss. While this may sound like a bad omen, it’s actually a positive symbol. Many believe that dragonflies represent the spirits of deceased loved ones and that they’re a peaceful symbol of life after death. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Good luck
steps.content: Good luck In many cultures, both dragonflies and the color red are considered good luck. Because of this, many people believe a red dragonfly will bring luck, prosperity, and good fortune to those who see them or to anyone the dragonfly lands on. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Transformation
steps.content: Transformation Dragonflies often symbolize transformation and rebirth because of their life cycle; they start their lives underwater before emerging as beautiful flying insects. [3] X Research source Red dragonflies may represent positive change, self-realization, and spiritual transformation.

steps.title: Love and passion
steps.content: Love and passion The color red is often associated with romance and intensity, so red dragonflies can also be a symbol of love. [4] X Research source They may indicate that love is on the way or that a romantic relationship is built to last. Red dragonflies can also be a sign that it’s time to make a move or start actively looking for love.

steps.title: Courage and protection
steps.content: Courage and protection Dragonflies have a predatory nature and hunt other insects, so they’re often associated with protection. [5] X Research source The color red also sometimes symbolizes courage and warns of danger. Because of this, red dragonflies often represent security and strength.

steps.title: You are or will soon be lucky in love.
steps.content: You are or will soon be lucky in love. Many people believe that red dragonflies are a sign from your ancestors or spirit guides that love is on the way. Red is a color often associated with love and passion, so seeing a red dragonfly might mean that you’ll soon find love or that your current relationship is going to last. [6] X Research source

steps.title: It’s time to take a risk for love.
steps.content: It’s time to take a risk for love. Dragonflies only live for a short time, so they’re often a reminder that time is precious and if you want something, you should go for it. This applies to romance, as well. Don’t sit around waiting for love to find you—go out and find it. If there’s someone you have a crush on, ask them out . It can be nerve-racking, but the red dragonfly may be a sign that it’s time to take a leap of faith. [7] X Research source If you’re not ready to ask someone out just yet, try striking up a conversation to get to know them as a person.

steps.title: Choose relationships that make you feel secure.
steps.content: Choose relationships that make you feel secure. While the color red is often associated with love, it can also represent a warning. [8] X Research source If you’re questioning a relationship and see a red dragonfly, it may be time to stop and consider if the relationship is worth pursuing. You may be attracted to the person, but do they make you feel secure? It may be time to think seriously about the kind of people you want in your life and to focus on those who make you feel happy and fulfilled.

steps.title: Keep passion and romance alive.
steps.content: Keep passion and romance alive. If you’re in a rocky relationship or feel like your romantic chemistry has dwindled, seeing a red dragonfly could indicate that it’s time to take matters into your own hands. Don’t sit around hoping things will change; start doing romantic things for your partner. Try surprising them with a nice dinner date, flirting with them throughout the day, or reminding them how much you love them.

steps.title: Your luck is about to change for the better.
steps.content: Your luck is about to change for the better. In many cultures, the color red represents good luck. Seeing a red dragonfly is often a sign that you’ll receive good fortune in many aspects of your life, including your finances. Say yes to new opportunities, get out of your comfort zone , and focus on ways you can create more abundance in your life. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Protect your financial security.
steps.content: Protect your financial security. The color red is associated with the root chakra, which represents security. [10] X Research source Seeing a red dragonfly could be a reminder from the universe to protect your financial interests. Make sure you can truly afford to do something rather than carelessly throwing your money around. If money is something you struggle with, consider creating a budget to help.

steps.title: Commit to lifelong learning.
steps.content: Commit to lifelong learning. Dragonflies have existed in some form for 300 million years, so ancient wisdom is imbued in their DNA. [11] X Trustworthy Source US National Park Service Agency responsible for the maintenance and promotion of national parks and monuments Go to source Red dragonflies often signify the importance of knowledge and wisdom, especially when it comes to careers and manifestation. Seeing one may mean the universe is encouraging you to learn as much as possible, especially in relation to your career field.

steps.title: Embrace change and try something new.
steps.content: Embrace change and try something new. Dragonflies often symbolize transformation and new beginnings, so seeing one may mean it’s time for a change, especially in relation to your career. If you’ve been wanting a promotion, start taking steps to make that happen. If you’ve been considering changing careers, it may be time to start putting in applications. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Chase your dreams.
steps.content: Chase your dreams. Red dragonflies symbolize passion, so seeing one can mean it’s time to go after your goals . [13] X Research source If you’ve been wanting something but have been too afraid to go for it, now is the time to take the plunge. Start thinking of your dream as an actual possibility and do what you need to achieve it.

steps.title: Believe in your body’s ability to heal.
steps.content: Believe in your body’s ability to heal. In some Native American cultures, like the Hopi and the Pueblo, dragonflies are associated with transformation and healing. [14] X Research source The color red is also associated with blood, which is a vital part of our life force. Seeing a red dragonfly could be a reminder to listen to your body and trust its ancient wisdom. While your body can heal minor illnesses and injuries, be sure to see a medical professional for more serious issues.

steps.title: Connect with your primal energy.
steps.content: Connect with your primal energy. Red is the color of primal energy, which is believed to be the energy that connects our bodies to the metaphysical and divine. [15] X Research source Seeing a red dragonfly could be a sign to connect with this energy through spiritual practices like yoga or meditation and by surrounding yourself with love and support so your body can thrive.

steps.title: Manifest wellness and vitality.
steps.content: Manifest wellness and vitality. Red dragonflies symbolize warmth, fire, and blood, so seeing them could mean it’s time to focus on warm, healing energy. Try meditating and envisioning this energy coursing through your bloodstream to bring you vitality and rejuvenation. The idea is that this will make your body and mind more alert and energetic.

steps.title: In Japan, red dragonflies symbolize courage.
steps.content: In Japan, red dragonflies symbolize courage. Dragonflies are often considered sacred in Japan, and they’re a symbol of courage, strength, and happiness. They’re frequently depicted in Japanese art and are considered a positive symbol. The samurai even used dragonfly designs on their armor as a symbol of victory. [16] X Research source

steps.title: In some Native American cultures, red dragonflies represent new beginnings.
steps.content: In some Native American cultures, red dragonflies represent new beginnings. Different Native American cultures associate dragonflies with different things, but in most cases, the dragonfly is a positive symbol. It frequently represents transformation, protection, healing, and happiness. [17] X Trustworthy Source University of California Division of Agriculture and Natural Resources Extension program of the University of California system devoted to educating and improving local communities Go to source For example, the Hopi and Pueblo cultures consider dragonflies to be a medicine animal, often associated with healing and transformation. Killing a dragonfly was very taboo in the Pueblo culture. In Plains Indian culture, dragonflies represent protection and invincibility, and they were frequently painted on war shirts to ward off danger. In some Native cultures, dragonflies also represent the souls of the dead. Visits from a dragonfly often meant that a deceased loved one’s soul was free.

steps.title: In China, red dragonflies represent good luck.
steps.content: In China, red dragonflies represent good luck. Both dragonflies and the color red are associated with good luck in China, so red dragonflies are believed to symbolize good fortune and prosperity. This prosperity can be associated with all aspects of life, including relationships and careers. [18] X Research source In the Chinese practice of feng shui, red is also associated with passion, fire, happiness, and new beginnings.

steps.title: In Christianity, dragonflies symbolize transformation.
steps.content: In Christianity, dragonflies symbolize transformation. While the Bible doesn’t mention dragonflies specifically, Christians often associate them with renewal and transformation. Like dragonflies transform from a nymph to their adult form, Christians experience a spiritual transformation when they find faith in Jesus. The dragonfly’s beautiful wings also serve as a reminder of the beauty that comes from living in God’s truth and grace.

steps.title: You’re going through a spiritual transformation.
steps.content: You’re going through a spiritual transformation. Like butterflies, dragonflies go through a metamorphosis before achieving their final form in adulthood. Because of this, seeing a red dragonfly often symbolizes self-realization, spiritual growth , and transformation. It may be a sign to focus on your spirituality or that you’ll overcome any challenges you’ve been facing. [19] X Research source

steps.title: You’re protected by angels or spirit guides.
steps.content: You’re protected by angels or spirit guides. Some people believe that dragonflies are messengers for angels or other spirits, as the insects are very receptive to divine energy. If a red dragonfly visits you, it may be a sign that an angel or the spirit of someone you love is present. This sign may mean that you’re spiritually protected and that good things will come your way. [20] X Research source Red dragonflies may specifically represent someone who had a fiery personality or brought good fortune to your life.

steps.title: It’s time to look for strength in your faith.
steps.content: It’s time to look for strength in your faith. Because dragonflies are often associated with the divine, seeing one could be a sign to focus on your faith or spirituality. Remember that there are powers in the universe that can accomplish incredible things. Trust that you’re being led down the right path. [21] X Research source For example, if you’re religious, seeing a red dragonfly may encourage you to pray more often.

steps.title: Pay attention to your root chakra.
steps.content: Pay attention to your root chakra. The root chakra is the first of the 7 main energy chakras in the body, located at the base of the spine. It is associated with the color red and represents energy, security, and good health. If you believe in chakras, seeing a red dragonfly may indicate that you need to balance or open the root chakra so you feel grounded and in-tune with the world around you. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Red dragonfly tattoos often symbolize transformation.
steps.content: Red dragonfly tattoos often symbolize transformation. A red dragonfly tattoo typically holds the same meanings as seeing a red dragonfly: transformation, good luck, courage, or love. Specifically, red dragonfly tattoos can represent a transformation from emotional struggles to a place of freedom. Those with a dragonfly tattoo may also choose their own personal meaning for the design, or it may have no specific meaning at all.

steps.title: Red dragonflies may seem rare, but there are several species.
steps.content: Red dragonflies may seem rare, but there are several species. You may not see red dragonflies as often as other colors, but they aren’t entirely rare. Depending on where you live, they may actually be quite common. They’re found all over the world, including parts of Asia, Africa, Europe, and the Americas. Here are some common species: [23] X Research source Desert Firetail Neon skimmer Roseate skimmer Red-tailed pennant Cardinal Meadowhawk Scarlet basker Scarlet skimmer Ruby meadowhawk Cherry-faced meadowhawk Red saddlebag
